refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "minimum-key-length" gint : Read / Write "model" GtkTreeModel : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Signal Prototypes
refsect1.synopsis: "action-activated" void user_function (GtkEntryCompletion *widget, gint index, gpointer user_data); "match-selected" gboolean user_function (GtkEntryCompletion *widget, GtkTreeModel *model, GtkTreeIter *iter, gpointer user_data);

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GtkEntryCompletion is an auxiliary object to be used in conjunction with GtkEntry to provide the completion functionality. It implements the GtkCellLayout interface, to allow the user to add extra cells to the GtkTreeView with completion matches.

"Completion functionality" means that when the user modifies the text in the entry, GtkEntryCompletion checks which rows in the model match the current content of the entry, and displays a list of matches. By default, the matching is done by comparing the entry text case-insensitively against the text column of the model (see gtk_entry_completion_set_text_column()), but this can be overridden with a custom match function (see gtk_entry_completion_set_match_func()).

When the user selects a completion, the content of the entry is updated. By default, the content of the entry is replaced by the text column of the model, but this can be overridden by connecting to the ::match-selected signal and updating the entry in the signal handler. Note that you should return TRUE from the signal handler to suppress the default behaviour.
To add completion functionality to an entry, use gtk_entry_set_completion().

In addition to regular completion matches, which will be inserted into the entry when they are selected, GtkEntryCompletion also allows to display "actions" in the popup window. Their appearance is similar to menuitems, to differentiate them clearly from completion strings. When an action is selected, the ::action-activated signal is emitted.

refsect2.title: struct GtkEntryCompletion
refsect2.para: The GtkEntryCompletion struct contains only private data.

refsect2.title: GtkEntryCompletionMatchFunc ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean (*GtkEntryCompletionMatchFunc) (GtkEntryCompletion *completion, const gchar *key, GtkTreeIter *iter, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: A function which decides whether the row indicated by iter matches a given key, and should be displayed as a possible completion for key.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeIter indicating the row to match
TRUE if iter should be displayed as a possible completion for key

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_completion_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkEntryCompletion object.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_completion_get_entry ()
refsect2.para: Gets the entry completion has been attached to.

listitem.simpara: The entry completion has been attached to.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_completion_set_model ()
refsect2.para: Sets the model for a GtkEntryCompletion. If completion already has a model set, it will remove it before setting the new model.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_completion_get_model ()
refsect2.para: Returns the model the GtkEntryCompletion is using as data source. Returns NULL if the model is unset.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeModel, or NULL if none is currently being used.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_completion_set_match_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_entry_completion_set_match_func (GtkEntryCompletion *completion, GtkEntryCompletionMatchFunc func, gpointer func_data, GDestroyNotify func_notify);
refsect2.para: Sets the match function for completion to be func. The match function is used to determine if a row should or should not be in the completion list.
Since 2.4.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_completion_set_minimum_key_length ()
refsect2.para: Requires the length of the search key for completion to be at least length. This is useful for long lists, where completing using a small key takes a lot of time and will come up with meaningless results anyway (ie, a too large dataset).

listitem.simpara: The minimum length of the key in order to start completing.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_completion_get_minimum_key_length ()
refsect2.para: Returns the minimum key length as set for completion.

listitem.simpara: The currently used minimum key length.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_completion_complete ()
refsect2.para: Requests a completion operation, or in other words a refiltering of the current list with completions, using the current key. The completion list view will be updated accordingly.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_completion_insert_action_text ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_entry_completion_insert_action_text (GtkEntryCompletion *completion, gint index, const gchar *text);
refsect2.para: Inserts an action in completion's action item list at position index with text text. If you want the action item to have markup, use gtk_entry_completion_insert_action_markup().

listitem.simpara: The index of the item to insert.
Text of the item to insert.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_completion_insert_action_markup ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_entry_completion_insert_action_markup (GtkEntryCompletion *completion, gint index, const gchar *markup);
refsect2.para: Inserts an action in completion's action item list at position index with markup markup.

listitem.simpara: The index of the item to insert.
Markup of the item to insert.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_completion_delete_action ()
refsect2.para: Deletes the action at index from completion's action list.

listitem.simpara: The index of the item to Delete.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_completion_set_text_column ()
refsect2.para: Convenience function for setting up the most used case of this code: a completion list with just strings. This function will set up completion to have a list displaying all (and just) strings in the completion list, and to get those strings from column in the model of completion.
This functions creates and adds a GtkCellRendererText for the selected column.

listitem.simpara: The column in the model of completion to get strings from.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

listitem.para: Minimum length of the search key in order to look up matches.
The model to find matches in.

refsect2.title: The "action-activated" signal
refsect2.para: The ::action-activated signal is emitted when an action is activated.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
the index of the activated action
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "match-selected" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkEntryCompletion *widget, GtkTreeModel *model, GtkTreeIter *iter, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: The ::match-selected signal is emitted when a match from the list is selected. The default behaviour is to replace the contents of the entry with the contents of the text column in the row pointed to by iter.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
a GtkTreeIter positioned at the selected match
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
TRUE if the signal has been handled
